alert.note: Alert for Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 7:06PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTH CENTRAL COOK COUNTY THROUGH 730 PM CDT... At 705 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over eastern Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness, or 12 miles southeast of Gunflint Lake, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow unsecured objects around. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Cook County, including the following locations... Bearskin Lake, Pine Lake, Poplar Lake, Daniels Lake and Clearwater Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Anyone outdoors, including anyone on or in the water, should seek shelter inside a sturdy building or hard topped vehicle. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive through flood waters. Anyone at a campground should seek sturdy shelter until this storm passes.

area.areaDesc: Northern Cook, Northern Lake; Southern Cook, North Shore
